name: places/ChIJPdqi7JdYwokRtr5Vo2jZysE
adrFormatAddress: 1035 5th Ave, New York, NY 10028-0135, USA

originalText.text: Dr.Gendler is amazing! I was referred to Dr.Gendler after having some complications with filler from a medspa. Dr.Gendler was professional, kind and thorough. She was able to dissolve all of the filler with precision using an ultrasound.  She has literally restored my confidence. I can not say enough about how amazing her and her practice have been!

text.text: Dr.Gendler is amazing! I was referred to Dr.Gendler after having some complications with filler from a medspa. Dr.Gendler was professional, kind and thorough. She was able to dissolve all of the filler with precision using an ultrasound.  She has literally restored my confidence. I can not say enough about how amazing her and her practice have been!

originalText.text: I've been going to Dr. Gendler for over fifteen years. She is empathetic, knowledgable, and extremely genuine. She doesn't push treatments or products unless you ask for them. She gives you her honest opinion about treatments and whether she thinks they will make a difference. I get botox and fillers and have never looked "overfilled." She is more conservative so that you look natural. I've never had any of the issues that some people complain about after getting botox. When I see her, it's like seeing a friend because of her warm personality and engaging manner. When I was diagnosed with bladder cancer, she recommended three doctors to me. She even facilitated my speaking with one of her patients who had surgery with one of the doctors she recommended. The one I chose is the most amazing doctor who I still see and who has spared my bladder! I never would have known about him if not for her. She also recommended a great female gynecologist who I still go to. I trust her implicitly. Her office is well run, she sees patients on time, and her staff is lovely. I recommend her without reservation.

originalText.text:
I've been a patient of this establishment for over 2ish years due to a prescribed medication. That's the primary reason for my continued visits. However, reaching out to them through email or phone has consistently been a significant challenge.

EDIT: I want to add that I never had an issue with the doctor. I'm more so frustrated with the lack of response on the other end.

originalText.text: i visited in november 2023 and specifically asked if my insurance covers the visit or there is a copay? they said no copay and recommended a follow up visit in 3 weeks (which was completely unnecessary). eventually it turned out that my insurance covers almost nothing and i was charged for 2 visits within 3 weeks. i then called the manager and asked to make a discount since i had full faith that there is no copay. they refused any discount. very unpleasant attitude.

originalText.text: Dr. Gendler is very nice and she is very educated in skincare and skin health. I would not, however, recommend seeing her for cosmetic botox injections. I had been going to my dermatologist in south jersey for years to get my regular botox, but after moving up north i decided to see Dr. Gendler. I received botox in my forehead area and I was not happy with my results. She injected too close to the eyebrow muscles which caused my eyelid area to droop and look heavy. Parts of my forehead were uneven and the results barely lasted 2 months. In the past, my botox would last 3-4 months at the very least. She charges over double the average as well. I'm sure she is a great medical dermatologist, but I would not recommend paying so much money for less than satisfactory cosmetic results.
